title.narrative: Women’s Refugee Commission: Danish Call to Action leadership, 2021-2022

description.narrative: Women’s Refugee Commission: Danish Call to Action leadership, 2021-2022 - Support Danish strategic leadership of Call to Action and to advance the updated Road Map with focus on humanitarian response to gender equality, localization and leadership and empowerment of women and girls Justification for choice of partner:

sector.narrative: Women's rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

description.narrative: FL §06.39.03.11 Other contributions to acute and prolonged crises

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Output 2.2.1: Action research on barriers and enablers is conducted to facilitate integrated responses to child marriage across sectors and between regional humanitarian and development actors

OI 1: Power mapping of regional key actors that are central to the well-being of forcibly displaced adolescent girls and their families completed to inform engagement strategy
OI 2: Lessons learned documented as to how regional humanitarian and development actors can further support and/or facilitate integrated responses to child marriage
OI 3: Lessons learned documented as to how to address child marriage using multi-sectoral approaches

target.value:
1: Power mapping of regional key actors that are central to the well-being of forcibly displaced adolescent girls and their families completed to inform engagement strategy
2: Lessons learned documented as to how regional humanitarian and development actors can further support and/or facilitate integrated responses to child marriage
3: Lessons learned documented as to how to address child marriage using multi-sectoral approaches

actual.value:
1: Rozaria Memorial Trust has worked to identify and map out the relevant stakeholders needed for impactful social change, creating a database of prospective participants for further project engagement (power mapping).
2 + 3: A consolidation of recommendations on what enables or hinders existing programming approaches related to prevention and response as well as the mechanisms to support collaboration and coordination amongst diverse stakeholders will be developed in Q1 2022

title.narrative: Output 2.1.2: Action research intervention of enablers and barriers of women-led CSO engagement with humanitarian GBV response in Kenya is conducted

OI 1: Kenyan research organization co-created the action research design with core working group
OI 2: Action research study of enablers and barriers of women-led CSO engagement with humanitarian GBV response completed

target.value:
Kenyan research organization co-created the action research design with core working group
Action research study of enablers and barriers of women-led CSO engagement with humanitarian GBV response completed

actual.value:
As part of building broad based ownership of the research project, WRC with support from HUSIKA embarked on co-creating a participatory, broad based stakeholder engagement process towards the feminist action research and advocacy planning project with stakeholders in Kenya to identify the barriers and facilitators to women led civil society response to GBV in response to crises and forced displacement.
Action research study completed. The findings from this research will inform an advocacy strategy to be developed by February of 2022 for creating a gender equitable, inclusive, and locally led and owned, context specific response to GBV in emergencies in Kenya. The plan will be supported by small grants to members of the working group to implement the action plan.

title.narrative: Output 1.1: Call to Action annual reporting processes are undertaken as a component of the initiative's accountability approach

OI 1: Findings of collective progress reports are available for the annual partners meeting
OI 2: Partner annual reports are published on the Call to Action website
OI 3: Collective annual reports for 2020 and 2021 that include data on key Road Map indicators are published on the Call to Action website

target.value: Partner and collective annual reports for 2020 published on Call to Action website

actual.value:
- Collected and analyzed Call to Action progress reports submitted by 40 partners, including all reports, which were received by the end of summer 2021. By the end of 2021, a total of 48 partner reports had been received – the same number received in 2019.
- Drafted the 2020 Progress Report for feedback from the partnership.
- Finalized and laid out 2020 report.
- Available state, IO, and NGO self-reports for 2020 are on the Call to Action website. The annual progress report will be posted following partner review.

target.value: Partner and collective annual reports for 2021 published on Call to Action website

title.narrative:
Part 1: Support Danish strategic leadership of Call to Action
Support Denmark in its engagements with the Call to Action Steering Committee and partners to ensure strategic leverage, effective functioning of the initiative, and accountability across the partnership at all levels - from global to field.
Denmark's leadership and WRC's support thereof leads to more robust engagement by Call to Action partners and a percentage increase in annual reporting and membership.

target.value:
- Collected and analyzed Call to Action progress reports submitted by 40 partners, including all reports, which were received by the end of summer 2021. By the end of 2021, a total of 48 partner reports had been received – the same number received in 2019.
- Drafted the 2020 Progress Report for feedback from the partnership.
- Finalized and laid out 2020 report.
- Available state, IO, and NGO self-reports for 2020 are on the Call to Action website. The annual progress report will be posted following partner review.

title.narrative: Output 2.1.3: Co-creation with the core working group and the anchor research institution of an advocacy plan that leverages the case study findings for action in humanitarian response to GBV in Kenya

OI 1: Analysis of case study findings produced and dissemintaed to key humanitarian and CSO actors
OI 2: Advocacy planning strategy for Call to Action in Kenya based on findings of the case study created with core working group
OI 3: Convening with core working group CSOs, research lead, and key operational humanitarian organizations in Kenya such as the Danish Refugee Council for presentation and discussion of operational implications
OI 4: Operational humanitarian organizations begin to apply lessons learned in their policy and guidance for GBV programming in Kenya
OI 5: Global HQ of an operational humanitarian INGO CtA member in Kenya, such as DRC, considers implications of GBV action research and planning in Kenya for their global guidance

target.value:
1: Analysis of case study findings produced and dissemintaed to key humanitarian and CSO actors
2: Advocacy planning strategy for Call to Action in Kenya based on findings of the case study created with core working group
3: Convening with core working group CSOs, research lead, and key operational humanitarian organizations in Kenya such as the Danish Refugee Council for presentation and discussion of operational implications
4: Operational humanitarian organizations begin to apply lessons learned in their policy and guidance for GBV programming in Kenya
5: Global HQ of an operational humanitarian INGO CtA member in Kenya, such as DRC, considers implications of GBV action research and planning in Kenya for their global guidance

title.narrative: Output 2.2.2: Learning and advocacy agenda is developed based on consultation process from year 1 action learnin research

OI 1: Preliminary findings and implications for practice and policy presented to stakeholder groups
OI 2: An action agenda is created to address challenges and leverage humanitarian and development actor strengths in addressing child marriage across the nexus and beyond sectoral siloes

target.value:
1: Preliminary findings and implications for practice and policy presented to stakeholder groups
2: An action agenda is created to address challenges and leverage humanitarian and development actor strengths in addressing child marriage across the nexus and beyond sectoral siloes

title.narrative: Part 2.1: The experiences and perspectives of civil society organizations that address GBV in Kenya inform both civil society and humanitarian actors' efforts to effectively localize addressing GBV in humanitarian response in Kenya
Action research of, and action plan to address, the barriers and enablers to women-led civil society's equitable and effective engagement with the humanitarian response to GBV in Kenya
Part 2.2: Humanitarian and development actors are equipped to collaborate across sectors and the nexus to drive transformative and sustainable interventions to address child marriage

Lessons learned from the action research on enablers and barriers of engaging across the humanitarian and development nexus and sectoral siloes are produced in order to contribute to the systematic transformation of the humanitarian system in the prevention and response to child marriage
Output 1.3: One-day workshops on the Call to Action are carried out in 6 humanitarian settings

OI 1: Number of workshops held
OI 2: Percentage of organizations represented that are local/national
OI 3: Percentage of organizations represented that are women's groups
OI 4: Number of attendees from humanitarian leadership and Call to Action partner organizations, including donor states
OI 5: Reports produced for each workshop and summary report produced at the end of year two

target.value: In-person workshops that draw on learning from the 2021 efforts are held in 4 additional humanitarian settings. A short report capturing key findinds and recommendations from the workshop project is shared with all partners before the end of 2022
Virtual workshops are held in 2 humanitarian settings with mixed groups of stakeholders

actual.value: No workshops held due to COVID-19. Planning initiated.

title.narrative: Output 2.1.1: A core working group of civil society actors (e.g. GROOTS, Refugee Consortium of Kenya, and This Ability) and operational humanitarian organizations, including DRC, is created and convened, representing the perspectives and experiences of women-led civil society that addresses GBV, including people with intersecting marginalized identities such as persons with disabilities, youth, and people of diverse ethnicities, sexual orientations and gender identities
OI 1: Core working group in Kenya formed

target.value: Core working group in Kenya formed

actual.value: Two core working groups have been formed (in Nairobi and Tana River, respectively). By December 2021, four working group meetings have taken place in Tana River while three have been held with the Nairobi core working group members making them a total of seven in both research sites.

title.narrative: Output 1.2: Call to Action annual partners meetings are held in 2021 (virtual) and 2022 (in person if possible) to identify priorities and actions

OI 1: 2021 and 2022 meetings are held
OI 2: There is partner satisfaction with meeting planning and content
OI3: Meeting reports are produced and posted on partners' section of Call to Action website

target.value: Under Denmark's direction, WRC takes the lead in the development of the 2022 meeting agenda, produces and/or coordinates production of background materials, disseminates materials to all participants in a timely fashion, writes the meeting report and circulates to the full partnership for follow up action. The assumption is this meeting will be in-person.

Under Denmark's direction, WRC takes the lead in the development of the 2021 meeting agenda, produces and/or coordinates production of background materials, disseminates materials to all participants in a timely fashion, writes the meeting report and circulates to the full partnership for follow up action. The assumption is this meeting will be virual.

actual.value:
WRC supported the 2021 virtual Call to Action annual partner meeting through the following actions:
- Supported org. of the meeting (obtaining quotes, working with PHAP as the technical provider w. interpretation). - Developed multiple iterations of draft agendas for consultation with the Steering Committee and the partnership. - Worked with CARE to coordinate timing of daily pre-meeting sessions, which they organized for local partners they were supporting. - Identified and implemented innovative approaches for engaging membership during the remote meeting considering access issues for partners. - Helped to identify facilitators for each of the different sessions and developed the detailed run of show. - Worked with PHAP to troubleshoot issues arising during the meeting. - Produced the draft meeting report for feedback from the partnership. - WRC support and facilitation role for the annual meeting was widely acknowledged with the exchange of multiple emails expressing member satisf
